notes: All tests start as not implemented. Coding agents must update these flags only after verifying behavior.

features.title: Landing page layout
features.description: A simple landing page at '/' showing title, description, editor area, run button, and output panel.

tests.description: Visiting '/' renders a heading like 'Online Python Compiler' and the main UI sections (editor, run button, output).
The layout is usable on a 375px wide viewport (no horizontal scrolling needed for core actions).

features.title: Basic code editor
features.description: Embed a code editor component that allows users to edit Python code with a starter snippet.

tests.description: On first load, the editor shows a default Python snippet such as 'print("Hello, world!")'.
User can type in the editor and the changes are preserved until reload.

features.title: Run button behavior
features.description: A run button that triggers code execution with loading state and disabled state while running.

tests.description: Clicking 'Run' sends the current editor content to the backend API route.
While the request is in-flight, the button shows a loading indicator and is disabled.

features.title: Python execution API route
features.description: Implement a Next.js API route /api/run-python that forwards code to a sandboxed Python execution service and returns stdout, stderr, and exit status.

tests.description: POST /api/run-python with a JSON body containing 'code' returns a JSON response.
Running simple code like 'print("Hello")' returns stdout containing 'Hello'.
Submitting invalid Python (e.g. 'pritn("Hi")') returns stderr with a syntax or name error message.

features.title: Output panel display
features.description: A dedicated output panel to show stdout, stderr, and a simple status label.

tests.description: After a successful run, stdout appears clearly in the output panel.
If there is an error, stderr is displayed in a visually distinct way (e.g. different section or style).

features.title: Network error handling
features.description: Gracefully handle failed API calls and show a friendly error message.

tests.description: If /api/run-python returns a 5xx or network error, the UI shows a non-technical error message and suggests retrying.

features.title: Minimal but clean styling
features.description: Apply basic styling for a clean, readable layout without heavy UI frameworks.

tests.description: Text, editor, and output areas are visually distinct and readable on both light and dark OS themes.

features.title: Basic accessibility
features.description: Ensure key interactive elements are keyboard-accessible and labeled.

tests.description: The Run button can be focused and activated via keyboard (e.g. Enter/Space).
Editor and output sections have appropriate labels or headings for screen readers.
